profileText: A Representative from Pennsylvania; born near Rising Sun, Cecil County, Md., August 14, 1796; pursued an academic course and was graduated from West Nottingham Academy; studied medicine at the University of Maryland, Baltimore, Md., and commenced practice in Shrewsbury, Pa., in 1824; elected as a Democrat to the Twenty-sixth and Twenty-seventh Congresses (March 4, 1839-March 3, 1843); continued the practice of medicine until 1870, when he retired; died in Shrewsbury, York County, Pa., July 19, 1873; interment in Lutheran Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: 1824-1891, 16 volumes.
researchRecord.description: Records of the Gerry Drug Store (Shrewsbury, Pa.). The pharmacy was owned by James Gerry, as well as other family members.

recordLocation.name: York County Heritage Trust/Historical Society of York County

researchRecord.name: In the James Gerry Family Papers, 1835-1861, 1 box.
researchRecord.description: Chiefly papers of James Gerry, including a daybook (1835, indexed), ledgers (3 v., 1826-1834), a promissory note, receipts, physician's licenses, a notebook of illnesses and remedies, financial papers, correspondence, a notice of appointment as coroner, certificates and booklets, reflecting his membership in the masons, and correspondence relating to the Civil War, his government service, and political views; father's estate papers; diary and letter (1830) of Sarah Gerry; agreement with Nathan Shaffer concerning a patent; and certificate of election to Congress in 1840.

recordLocation.name: York County Heritage Trust/Historical Society of York County
